_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 16:54:46 using v2.0
title: How do employment rates vary by age?
analysis_commentary: The disparity in employment rates between people with LTCs and the general population is lowest in the younger age groups (differences of 6.7% in 16-19 year olds and 6.1% in 20-24 year olds) and oldest (difference of 6.3% in those aged 60 and over) age groups. Between these ages, the difference ranges from 11.6% to 15.8%.
